html:
** ING cuts Belgium's postal services provider Bpost BPOST.BR to "hold" from "buy" saying 2022 will face many headwinds, but many seem already priced-in

** "Inflationary pressures combined with tough comps, less stamp price compensation in mail, VAT aftermath, potential Amazon pressures, will in our view more than offset the underlying positives from Radial and cost savings," ING says

** It lowers its EBIT expectation for the year by 13% to 275 million euros, while cutting target price by 33% to 7 euros

** The brokerage believes 2022 will be a transition year towards recovery beyond driven by growth in e-commerce and strong cost savings, but lacks visibility an both the upside and downside

** It sees limited room for a re-rating in the short term and adds that "it will take some time to get a feel for the near-term trough and longer-term upside"

** Among the ten analysts covering the stock, four rate it "strong buy" or "buy" and six "hold"


(Reporting by Olivier Cherfan)

(( olivier.cherfan@thomsonreuters.com ))
